plugins.name: Base64 Encoder
plugins.description:
A Figma plugin that streamlines the process of using SVGs in web projects by automating the export, optimisation, and conversion to base64-encoded data URIs for both CSS and HTML.


Overview

If you've ever needed to embed SVGs directly in your code, you know the process can be tedious:


  1. Export the SVG from Figma
  2. Optimise it with a tool like SVGO
  3. Convert it to base64
  4. Format it properly for CSS or HTML


This plugin automates the entire workflow with a single click. Select any frame or element in Figma and instantly copy optimised, base64-encoded SVGs ready to use as:


HTML <img> tags

CSS background-image properties

CSS mask-image properties (with customisable colours)


When to Use Base64-Encoded SVGs


Base64-encoded SVGs are particularly useful for:


  1. Email templates where external images may be blocked or filtered
  2. CSS backgrounds and decorative elements when you want to avoid additional HTTP requests
  3. Custom list markers that need to maintain consistency across email clients
  4. Icon systems where you need a small number of icons without the overhead of an icon font
  5. Mask images in CSS when you need a shape with a customisable fill colour
  6. Offline applications or environments with limited connectivity
  7. Performance optimisation for small, frequently used graphics


In these scenarios, embedding SVGs directly in your code eliminates HTTP requests, avoids CORS issues, and ensures visual elements display correctly regardless of external resource availability.
plugins.tagline: Instantly export, optimise, and convert SVGs to base64 for CSS and HTML 🚀

plugins.name: Perceptually Uniform Gradients
plugins.description:
By default, Figma can generate some gradients that get really muddy as they transition from color to color. With this plugin you can generate gradients using color models which handle interpolation better, which translates to more beautiful gradients.


Features:

  1. Generate gradients in Lab, OKLCH, or LCH and insert them into your Figma files as a continuous gradient or as individual, evenly-spaced stops
  2. Extract key colors from your current selection
  3. Copy raw text color scales out of the plugin in JSON format
  4. Generate multi-hue gradients
  5. Automatically correct the lightness distributions of your gradients
  6. Generate bezier-curved gradients in the Lab color space
  7. Adjust the gamma distribution of your gradients
  8. Select colors from a curated library of options
  9. Drag and drop to reorder colors
plugins.tagline: Generate more beautiful gradients by interpolating them with perceptually uniform color models.

plugins.name: Tuned Variables
plugins.description:
Tuned Variables

A Figma plugin for creating simple mathmatical expressions with local variables


🔥 Features:

  • Create values based on simple mathmatical expressions
  • Use other variables as values for an expression
  • Reference variables from other groups
  • Reference variables from other collections


🚀 How to use:

  1. In a variable, update its description with an expression like so: {{ 2 + 2 }}
  2. In the menu bar, click on the plugin, and it will run through all your variables and update their values if an expression is set.
  3. To use other variables as values reference them like so: {{ $base * 2 }}. This will take the value from the value with the name base
  4. To use nested variables simply use their name: {{ $Font/Size/base * 2}}. This will take the value base from the group Size inside the group Font
  5. To use variables from other collections prepend the variable name with the collection name. Example: If you have a collection called primitives then write it like so $primitives/Font/Size/base - this will get the variable Font/Size/base inside the primitives collection


🚧 Limitations:

Only Number variables at the moment

Modes are isolated, so you can't use a variable value from another mode.

Only simple operators are supported: *, /, +, -


🎁 Contribute:

If you want to improve the plugin, then you are very welcome to create a PR


🤝 License:

This will stay forever free and you are welcome to use this in personal and business use.


💎 Need more advanced featues?

I don't have plans to make this plugin more advanced, so if you need more advanced features i would recommend you to check out the Dynamic Variables by @neelts
plugins.tagline: Reference other variables and create simple calculations for dynamic values

plugins.name: ComfyUI-Image-Generator-Advance
plugins.description:
ComfyUI Image Generator Advance

Seamlessly Integrate Any ComfyUI Workflow

Powered by Comfy Deploy, this plugin bridges Figma with limitless AI workflows. Unleash unparalleled freedom to connect Figma and AI—customize, innovate, and create without boundaries!


---


Features

Unlock ComfyUI’s Full Potential:

Every feature ComfyUI offers is at your fingertips. If you can build it in ComfyUI, you can integrate it with Figma for AI-powered image generation!

Endless Customization:

Turn complex workflows into streamlined Figma actions.


---


Quick Start Guide

  1. Registeron: deploy.comfyui.asia
  2. Install the comfyui-deploy plugin in ComfyUI and configure your workflow . see tutorial.
  3. Deploy your workflow on deploy.comfyui.asia , configure GPU settings (you can use your own GPU), and obtain your API key.
  4. Launch the ComfyUI Image Generator Advance plugin in Figma, enter your API key, and start generating—your custom workflow parameters will auto-load!


FAQ


Q: Is this plugin free?

A: We offer affordable paid plans to cover server costs and future upgrades. Your support keeps the innovation alive! 💡


Q: Why are generated images downscaled?

A: To ensure smooth data transfer and avoid bottlenecks, images are temporarily resized to a max of 1536 px on the longest edge. For full resolution, use upscaling workflows after initial processing.


Q: Why do requests sometimes fail?

A: ComfyUI’s API is still evolving. Check your browser console for errors, refresh the plugin, or retry the task. Ensure stable internet—**VPN required for users in mainland China**.


Q: Are servers located in China?

A: No. Due to AI regulations and licensing complexities, servers are hosted overseas. Users in China may experience slight latency; a stable VPN connection is recommended.


---


Full Documentation** → Get Started

Explore More→ Visit Our Official Site


---


Why Choose Us?

  1. Flexible Workflows: Your creativity, your rules.
  2. Global Scalability: Cloud-powered performance, wherever you are.
  3. Pro-Level Control: Perfect for designers and developers alike.
plugins.tagline: Seamlessly Integrate Any ComfyUI Workflow

plugins.name: Bulk Interaction Updater
plugins.description:
Frustrated with manually updating interactions in your Figma prototypes? The Bulk Interaction Updater plugin is here to save you time and effort! 🎉


Watch demo:

https://youtu.be/1lHky16uoOw


With Figma's variable interaction nature, bulk editing has been a challenge—until now. This plugin empowers you to:

plugins.name: Material Font Name Finder
plugins.description:
Provides a streamlined workflow for Material Symbols icons fonts, eliminating the need to switch between applications or manually copy icons from external sources.


Features

  1. Icon Finder - Browse through the complete collection of Material Symbols icons organized by categories or search for a specific icon by name.
  2. Text Node Updating - When a text object is selected, clicking an icon replaces the text with the icon character.
  3. Font Application - Automatically applies a Material Symbols font to the selected text node on the Figma canvas.
  4. Clipboard Fallback - If no text object is selected, copies the icon name to clipboard with a helpful notification.


Font Compatibility

  1. Font Detection - Automatically detects if a Material Symbols font is installed on your local system. Requires the Material Symbols font to be installed locally on the user's system.
  2. Icon Validation - Material Symbol list loaded from Google’s Github repository. Plugin tests each icon to ensure it renders properly with the installed font. Automatically hides icons that don't render correctly.
  3. Text Style Override - Insert icons without disrupting your existing text styles if you already have local styles mapped to Material Symbols fonts.
  4. Statistics Display - Provides visual feedback during icon loading and validation. Shows total icons loaded, valid icons, and hidden icons.

plugins.name: Utopia Spacers
plugins.description:
The Utopia Spacers plugin uses the Utopia Fluid Space Calculator to generate a variable collection of number variables across a variety of comp size modes.


How to Use

  1. Visit Utopia.fyi and create a system of spacers using their fluid space calculator linked above.
  2. By default, spacers are only shown at their min and max size. To use this plugin, add one or more custom viewport sized by clicking the black + in the top right of the calculator's calculated values (see images).
  3. Once you're happy with your system, copy and paste the URL into the plugin. A new set of variables called "Utopia Spacers" will generate in your Local Variables.
  4. Use the spacers as normal variables. If you need to update values or add sizes, you can update the calculator and copy/paste the new, updated URL to bring in your changes.


Tips

  • Make sure the first viewport you enter is the size you'll be designing in (we use 1440px).
  • If you have a Starter Figma account, you're limited to only 1 mode. If you have a Professional or Organization level account you can use up to 4 modes. Enterprise accounts can use up to 40 modes.
  • We use 390px for mobile, 768 for tablet, 1440 for desktop, and 2560 for XL desktop.
  • Make sure to save your most-current Utopia URL somewhere so you can reference it easily.

accepted.name: Kylie LaCour
accepted.description: Enthusiast of elegant digital systems, dedicated advocate of fluid responsive design, and novice creator of plugins.

plugins.tagline: Generate a variable collection of fluid responsive spacers based on the Utopia.fyi design system.

✨ Key Features

  1. One-Click Variable Replacement — Replace any variable throughout your entire page instantly
  2. Comprehensive Variable Support — Works with dimensions, strokes, fills, shadows, fonts, and more
  3. Style Integration — Even replace the variable in styles that use your target variables, ensuring complete system consistency
  4. Multiple Library Sources — Select variables from both local and team shared libraries
  5. Lightning-Fast Performance — Process thousands of elements in seconds
  6. Design System Friendly — Perfect for design system refactoring and maintenance


🔄 How It Works

  1. Select the variable you want to replace
  2. Click "Find" to target all its occurrences on page

  4. Click "Replace" and watch the magic happen
  5. That's it! All instances are updated instantly


Don't let variable replacement slow down your design workflow. Install now and transform how you work with Figma variables!

plugins.name: I18n exporter
plugins.description:
Tabbed JSON Viewer for Figma


Transform your text variables into JSON format required by i18n libraries for language translations directly within Figma!


How It Works

Prepare Your Variables: Ensure your variable collections are correctly named i18n in Figma. This is crucial for the plugin to identify and process the variables meant for internationalization.


Fetch Variables: Click on the Get Variables button to automatically fetch and transform your project's i18n variables into a structured JSON format.


View and Copy: The plugin conveniently displays your variables in a tabbed interface, organized by language. Simply select the desired language tab to view the JSON output. Use the copy button to copy the JSON to your clipboard for easy integration into your i18n workflow.


Clear JSON: Want to start over or clean up? Click Clear JSON to reset the output area.


Features

Easy-to-use Interface: A user-friendly UI with a tabbed display allows for seamless navigation and operation.

Efficient Variable Conversion: Quickly converts your Figma text variables into i18n-compatible JSON.

Flexible Copy Options: Copy individual languages or the entire JSON output with a single click.


Getting Started

To get started, ensure your variable collections within Figma are named i18n. This naming convention is essential for the plugin to recognize and process your text variables for translation. Once set up, click on the Get Variables button to convert and view your variables in JSON format.


Whether you're developing multilingual designs or working on international projects, this plugin simplifies the translation process by seamlessly integrating with your i18n libraries.


Enhance your design workflow and embrace global accessibility with the Tabbed JSON Viewer for Figma.


Note: This plugin is an independent tool designed to facilitate the conversion of text variables to JSON for i18n libraries. It is not an official i18n plugin or affiliated with any official i18n library developers.
plugins.tagline: I18n exporter

plugins.name: Scaffolder
plugins.description:
Scaffolder sets up the pages that are in a project based on a proven formula for small, large and enterprise design systems. You can choose one of 4 options.


Small Project (Design + Style Hints)

Includes pages for mood board, style hints, designs, research, and components. This type is for small projects that don't need a full style guide.


Large Project (Design + Style Guide)

Includes pages for mood board, page types, style guide, designs, research, and components. This type is for large projects that need a full style guide as well as multiple application modules/areas.


Enterprise Project (Design)

Includes pages for designs and research. This type is for enterprise projects that not only needs a style guide, but also needs to separate the design system, guide, and components from the page designs. This is meant to be used along with the 'Enterprise Project (Theme)' type.


Enterprise Project (Theme)

Includes pages for mood board, page types, style guide, and components. This type is used to build out the style guide, design system, and components that will be used with the 'Enterprise Project (Design)' file.


Note: Once you run the plugin, do not run it again or you might get duplicate pages. It will not remove existing pages except for the initial, default page.
plugins.tagline: Scaffolds project page setup for quick, consistent design file.

> Transform your Figma designs with AI-powered image generation, right where you need it!

1. Powerful AI Models

A: This model gives you complete control over your API usage and costs, with no hidden fees or arbitrary limits.


💡 Coming Soon

- More AI models and workflows

- Advanced batch processing

- Custom style presets

139502.release_notes:
# Release Notes v1.3.1

## 🎯 What's Fixed

### LLM Prompt Enhancement Now Works Correctly
**Problem**: When you switched between different model types (like from Context Transform to Text-to-Image), the prompt enhancer wasn't updating properly. You might get the wrong type of enhancement.

**Solution**: Fixed! Now each model type gets its own specialized prompt enhancement:
- **Context Transform models** get enhancement focused on image modifications
- **All other models** get enhancement focused on creative image generation

## 🔍 How to Test the Fix

1. **Try Context Transform**:
   - Select "Context transform (Flux Kontext Pro)"
   - Type a prompt like "make it cartoon style"
   - Click the ✨ enhance button
   - You'll get prompts focused on image transformation

2. **Switch to Text-to-Image**:
   - Select "Text to image (FLUX Schnell)"
   - Use the same prompt "make it cartoon style"
   - Click the ✨ enhance button
   - You'll get prompts focused on creative generation

3. **Notice the Difference**:
   - Context models: "Change the style to cartoon while maintaining..."
   - Text-to-Image models: "90s cartoon animation style, bright colors..."

## ✨ What You'll Experience

- **More Accurate Enhancements**: Each model type gets the right kind of prompt improvement
- **Consistent Results**: No more confusing or inappropriate enhancements
- **Better Image Quality**: Properly enhanced prompts lead to better generation results

## 🔧 Technical Details (For Developers)

- Enhanced LLM service initialization logic
- Better model type detection and classification
- Improved debug information in console
- More robust service state management

---

**Need Help?** Check the browser console for debug information, or contact support if you experience any issues.

**Version**: 1.3.1 | **Release**: December 2024

plugins.name: Source DS Utils
plugins.description:
Bunch of utilities for Source Design System and Source Foundation plugin. I feel like these automations can be useful for everyone who designs in Figma.


This is a UI-less plugin that uses Figma quick actions to run automations.


Export component templates

Select components or frames with components and run the command to copy all these components as frames. You can use these copies to import component templates back.


Import component templates

Select a frame with exported component templates and run the command. This command will either replace target component content with the contents of the template or it will merge layers


Fix layers

Sometimes Figma does not resize absolutely positioned layers when you update something rapidly. When you spot such rouge layers went off you can fix them with this automation.


This command finds all absolutely positioned layers inside auto layout frames and snaps their size back to fit the parent.


Create color Styles

This command will create colour styles that are bound to the variables of the same name.


Clone component

Effortlessly clone any component or component set. When you copy/paste a simple component with lots of properties Figma creates a component instance. This automation creates an identical copy with all the properties available.


Make local component

Simplify workflow for slot components. This automation takes the instance inside another component, creates a local copy of that instance, makes it a component and swaps it with that component.


Slot to local component

Simplify workflow for slot components. This automation takes the instance, checks instance swap properties and enables you to swap it with newly created component. Lear more here -> https://forum.figma.com/t/slot-component-workflow-plugin/93749


Update Elevation Components

This is Source Design System specific automation. It reads effect styles and updates custom-made elevation components to match effect shadows.


Set Playground

Mark any file as Source Foundation Playground. This plugin uses figma.root.setPluginData method from plugin API to toggle 'SDSPlayground' property.
plugins.tagline: Automations for Source Design system

plugins.name: Halftone Converter
plugins.description:
This tool transforms any selected image into a customizable halftone effect, using individual ellipse layers to simulate tonal shading. You can control:


•Dot Size – Adjust the diameter of each dot to refine visual granularity

•Dot Density – Increase or decrease how many dots are used to represent the image


Once applied, the halftone output is placed in a Figma frame as editable ellipses, allowing for manual adjustment, recoloring, or animation. It’s ideal for designers looking to stylize artwork with a print-inspired, dot-matrix look.
plugins.tagline: Transform any image into editable halftone dots. Adjust size, density, and style directly in Figma.

plugins.name: Stray Component & Variable Finder (Ghost, Unindexed, Orphaned, Etc.)
plugins.description:
What is this plugin good for?


This plugin makes it easy to identify ‘stray’ component or variables within a design file.


What is a ‘stray' component/variable

A stray component or variable is one that either:

(1) is no longer properly linked to its original library (because the library was removed or changed), or

(2) was left behind from a previous library you no longer want to use.


Figma often identifies these in your assets panel as libraries that are ‘used in this file’ but they does not give you any indication of WHERE in the file they are being used. This plugin makes it easy to identify these components.


𖨠𖨠𖨠 If you find this plugin useful, and you feel like it, throw me some coffee dollars. 𖨠𖨠𖨠


How do I use this plugin?


1. Identify libraries you want to keep.

Start by opening the file where you want to find and fix stray components or variables. In the Assets panel, review the libraries that are currently being used in the file.


2. Index the libraries you don't want flagged as stray.

Open the plugin inside each library file you want to keep.

In the Library Manager tab, click "Index Library" for each one.

This ensures that components and variables from these libraries won't be flagged as stray later.


3. Return to your target file and run a scan.

Go back to your target file. In the plugin, open the "Scan Components/Variables" tab and choose whether you want to scan for components or variables.

The plugin will search your file for anything not included in your indexed libraries.


4. Review the results.

You'll see a list of all stray components or variables it found, along with helpful details like node names and their location in the file.





More Specific FAQ Questions 


What is the difference between Variable View and Node View for variables?


Variable View:

Organizes the scan results by each specific stray variable.

You can see all the places across your file where a particular stray variable appears.


Node View:

Organizes the scan results by the nodes that have the most stray variables.

This helps you prioritize fixing nodes with the highest number of issues, regardless of the variable types.


The scan is identifying components that belong to one of my indexed libraries as a Stray, what’s going on?


The most likely answer is that the component was deleted from the library. When this happens the component in the target file will point to its original library but does not actually exist there any longer (and therefore was not indexed)


Why can’t the plugin identify the library the stray component/variable comes from?


The Figma Plugin API does not expose data about files you own or have access to, so there is no way to get this information without adding an Authentication flow


Why can’t the plugin display the name of each variable in the results list?


Similar to the answer above, the Plugin API cannot get the name of variables from files that it does not have access to. It can only access the local name of the variable which tends to be semantically meaningless. Sorry.


Can I scan for both components and variables at the same time?


No, you’ll need to run the scan separately for components and variables. Maybe this could come in a future update.


Do I need to re-index libraries if they change?


Yes. If you update a library (e.g. delete or rename components/variables), it's a good idea to re-open that file and click “Index Library” again to make sure your scan stays accurate.


How long does the scan take?


The indexing and scanning process should be relatively quick (~3 to 30 seconds) generally; however the processing time is related to how big of a file you are scanning.
plugins.tagline: Search find and fix unused, orphaned, or unindexed library components & variables in your file

plugins.name: FigShare Links
plugins.description:
FigShare Intro:

  1. Seamlessly & Instantly Embed Your Figma Designs Everywhere
  2. With FigShare, embedding your Figma designs on websites and other platforms is effortless.
  3. No more jumping between tools to update assets—just manage everything directly from Figma.


Official Website:

  1. https://www.figshare.xyz/


Why FigShare?

  1. ✅ Automatic Updates with Every Publish
  2. ✅ Publish changes in Figma, and FigShare automatically reflects them in your embedded images.
  3. ✅ No more back-and-forth between designers and developers to keep assets up-to-date.


Where Can You Use FigShare?

You can embed FigShare images almost anywhere, including:

  1. Slack, Linkedin, X, Reddit, and more...
  2. Design System Documentation
  3. Blog Posts
  4. Social Media Banners & Covers
  5. Link Meta Previews
  6. Portfolios & Websites


Turn your Figma designs into instant, shareable links.

  1. Instant Links: Generate shareable links for any frame or image in seconds.
  2. Seamless Collaboration: Share specific design sections effortlessly with your team or clients.
  3. Real-Time Updates: Links automatically reflect your latest design


Pricing

  1. Try FigShare for free with up to 10 images. Need more? Upgrade anytime for $5/month to unlock additional images.
  2. For team accounts that allow shared access across multiple users, contact us directly to explore options.


With FigShare, say goodbye to workflow friction and hello to effortless design updates.

plugins.name: Extract content strings
plugins.description:
Read the post and documentation for this plugin.

Download a test file.


This Figma plugin helps you surface and extract content strings from your designs by scanning your Figma file for text layer names containing unique IDs, making it easy to copy and paste content strings for use outside of Figma.


How this plugin works

This plugin scans text layers on the current page of Figma file for content that matches the prefix of the unique ID (e.g., “content_string_”) you define. Most developers rely on prefixes to organize and manage these strings, and a typical content string might look something like this:


key: 'user.profile.settings.modal.description'

value: 'Adjust your profile settings'

context: 'A brief description indicating the purpose of the modal.'


A content string can include additional details, like the “context” in this example, but it must always contain a unique ID (sometimes referred to as a key, ID, or token) and the actual content, often called the value:


key: 'user.profile.settings.modal.description'

value: 'Adjust your profile settings'


Developers use the unique ID in their code to reference and display the corresponding content. This approach is particularly useful when localizing content, allowing teams to manage translations easily. By separating content from the code, developers can easily swap out language-specific strings without disrupting the application.


How to use this plugin

This plugin requires some initial manual setup to link unique IDs with content. Once configured, you can quickly copy and paste all your content strings!


The plugin scans text layers on the current Figma page for content strings that match the prefix of the unique ID you define (e.g., “content_string_”).


For example, if your content strings begin with “user.profile”, you’ll use that as your prefix.


  1. Example unique ID: user.profile.settings.modal.description
  2. Your search prefix: user.profile


Ensure the full unique ID is used as the layer name for the corresponding text.


  1. Text layer name: user.profile.settings.modal.description


In summary

  1. Define a prefix for your content strings (e.g., “user.profile”).
  2. Ensure the full unique ID is used as the text layer name (e.g., “user.profile.settings.modal.description”).
  3. Enter your prefix and run a search.
  4. The plugin will scan the text layers and match content based on your prefix.
  5. Easily copy and paste the extracted content strings.
plugins.tagline: Extract content strings from you Figma files with unique IDs in layer names.

plugins.name: Figma to PostGrid
plugins.description:
Figma to PostGrid


The Figma to PostGrid Plugin is built for designers and developers, letting you easily export your Figma designs into ready-to-use PostGrid templates. This means you can leverage the power of Figma's design tools to create stunning and personalized direct mail pieces, all without leaving Figma.


What can you do with the Plugin?


  1. Works great with how you already design: No need to make major shifts within your systems, tools and tech stacks, the plugin works seamlessly with your existing design workflow!
  2. One-click export: Export your beautiful designs directly into PostGrid with just a few clicks.
  3. Make it yours: Use merge variables to add personalized information to each piece of mail, making it unique.
  4. Ditch the PDFs: Forget about static PDFs and create mailers that are more engaging and interactive.


How to get started


  1. Open the plugin in your Figma workspace.
  2. Sign in using your PostGrid account credentials or add the test/live API key.
  3. Click on "Create Template" to add the supported template and create the collateral from scratch.
  4. Click on "Export Template" once you are ready with the collateral design.


Access the detailed guide to help you get started.


Reach out to support@postgrid.com if you have any questions or issues.
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly convert Figma designs into dynamic PostGrid direct mail templates.
